Bake in the preheated oven until the sides are set but the middle is still jiggly, 10 to 13 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

title: Rocky Road Candies
description: If a Rocky Road candy bar is your favorite treat, this recipe is one to try. Just stir peanuts and marshmallows into melted chocolate, then chill until firm. It couldn't be easier!
steps: Gather all ingredients
Line a 9x13-inch pan with waxed paper.
Heat chocolate chips and butter in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second increments, stirring occasionally, until melted and smooth. Stir in condensed milk.
Mix peanuts and mini marshmallows together in a separate bowl.
Gradually stir into chocolate mixture until incorporated.
Pour into the prepared pan. Refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours.
Cut into 24 squares. Enjoy!

title: Peanut Butter Eggs
description: My mom made peanut butter eggs at Easter for many years. She would put our names on them in frosting and decorate them with bunnies and flowers. You can make smaller eggs if desired. These chocolate-dipped treats bring back wonderful memories.
steps: Beat confectioners' sugar, peanut butter, and butter in a large mixing bowl until well blended; mix in milk if needed for moisture. Divide mixture in half and form into two large eggs. Place eggs onto on a wax paper-lined plate and freeze until firm, about 1 hour.

When the eggs are almost ready, combine chocolate and shortening in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Melt over medium heat, stirring frequently until smooth. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes.

Remove eggs from the freezer. Carefully stick a long-tined fork in the top of an egg; gently dip it in melted chocolate until covered, then return it to the waxed paper. Repeat to dip remaining egg. Decorate as desired.

title: Dark Chocolate Cake I
description: This recipe features an icing made with cream cheese, cocoa, and cinnamon frosts this dark chocolate cake for an elegant dessert.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 3 - 9 inch round cake pans. In medium bowl, pour boiling water over cocoa, and whisk until smooth. Let mixture cool. Sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt; set aside.

In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at time, then stir in vanilla. Add the flour mixture alternately with the cocoa mixture. Spread batter evenly between the 3 prepared pans.
Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes. Allow to cool.

title: Melt In Your Mouth Toffee
description: This is the easiest, best toffee I have ever made. Everyone who tries it wants the recipe.
steps: In a heavy saucepan, combine butter, white sugar, and brown sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture boils. Boil to brittle stage, 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) without stirring. Remove from heat.
Pour nuts and chocolate chips into a 9x13 inch dish. Pour hot mixture over the nuts and chocolate. Let the mixture cool and break it into pieces before serving.

title: S'mores at Home
description: Quick, easy, and delicious indoor S'mores. They're messy but tasty.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish.

In a medium bowl, combine butter, sugar and graham cracker crumbs until well coated. Press half of crumb mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan. Top with the chocolate chips, then the marshmallows. Sprinkle the remaining graham cracker mixture over the marshmallows and press down with a spatula.
Bake in preheated oven 10 minutes, until marshmallows are melted. Cool completely before cutting into squares. I Made It

title: Chocolate Cavity-Maker Cake
description: A rich, moist chocolate cake so indulgent it doesn't need frosting. This cake is perfect for chocolate lovers and makes a great impression at gatherings.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10-inch Bundt pan.

In a large bowl, beat together the cake mix, pudding mix, sour cream, eggs, vegetable oil, and coffee-flavored liqueur until well blended. Fold in the chocolate chips; the batter will be thick. Spoon into the prepared Bundt pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until the cake springs back when lightly tapped. Cool the cake in the pan for 10 minutes before turning it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Chocolate Pretzel Treats
description: Pretzel Hershey kiss treats topped with M&Ms candies. These are really fun to make with the kids for a wonderful chocolate treat.
steps: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees F (80 degrees C).
Arrange pretzels in a single layer on a baking sheet. Place a candy kiss in the center of each pretzel.
Warm in the preheated oven for about 2 minutes, until the kisses are shiny and slightly softened.
Press an M&M candy atop each softened kiss. Chill in the refrigerator for 10 minutes until firm.

title: Chocolate Fondue
description: This chocolate fondue recipes combines melted grated chocolate bars with heavy cream, coffee powder, and vanilla for a rich and creamy chocolaty treat! Serve with fruit or pieces of leftover cake on skewers.
steps: Combine grated milk chocolate and heavy cream in a saucepan over medium heat; stir until melted and smooth.
Mix in hot water, coffee powder, vanilla extract, and sugar.
Continue to heat and stir frequently until the fondue is smooth and ready for serving.

title: Chocolate-Covered Strawberries
description: These chocolate-covered strawberries are made with the simplest recipe I know. White chocolate may be drizzled over the milk chocolate for a fancier look. They are perfect for parties, Valentine's Day, and weddings. Decorate with frosting bow ties, bells, butterflies, hearts, roses, etc.
steps: Melt milk chocolate chips and shortening in a double boiler, stirring until smooth.
Insert toothpicks into the tops of strawberries.
Dip each strawberry into the melted chocolate, turning upside down to let excess drip off.
Place the dipped strawberries on waxed paper or insert the toothpick into a Styrofoam block to cool and harden.

title: Aunt Teen's Creamy Chocolate Fudge
description: This is the best fudge recipe ever! It's my aunt's recipe, passed down through the family. It's better than any fudge I've ever had at the Jersey shore and easy enough to whip up in 15 minutes or so.
steps: Line an 8-inch square pan with aluminum foil and set aside.
In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, marshmallow creme, evaporated milk, butter, and salt. Bring to a full boil, cooking for 5 minutes while stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, stir in both types of chocolate chips until melted and smooth.
Mix in nuts and vanilla. Pour into prepared pan.
Chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours or until firm. Cut into squares.

title: Chocolate Pretzels
description: Easy-to-make chocolate pretzels topped with candy-coated chocolates for a sweet and salty treat.
steps: Gather ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spread pretzels evenly on baking sheets. Unwrap candy kisses and place one in the center of each pretzel.
Bake for 1 to 2 minutes until kisses melt. Remove from oven and gently press a mini candy-coated chocolate into each melted kiss.
Chill in the refrigerator until set.

title: Easy Chocolate Chip Pound Cake
description: A rich, moist Bundt cake with chocolate chips and a hint of chocolate pudding.
steps: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10-inch Bundt pan.
Stir together cake mix, sugar, and instant pudding in a large bowl. Mix in beaten eggs, sour cream, water, and oil until well blended. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into the prepared Bundt pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 50 to 60 minutes. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust cooled cake with confectioners' sugar before serving.

title: Chocolate Covered Caramels
description: These caramels are easy and WONDERFUL for anytime of the year! Everyone loves them! I can't make enough of them. You can omit the chocolate and just have wonderful caramels.
steps: Grease an 8x8-inch square pan.

In a heavy 4 quart saucepan melt butter over medium heat; add brown sugar, corn syrup and milk. Stirring constantly, heat to 242 to 248 degrees F (116 to 120 degrees C), or until a small amount of syrup dropped into cold water forms a firm but pliable ball. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Pour into prepared pan.
When caramel has cooled and set, cut into 1-inch squares and chill in the refrigerator until firm.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler or microwave until smooth.
Dip caramel squares into chocolate and place on wax paper to cool.

title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups
description: A simple yet decadent treat combining creamy peanut butter with smooth milk chocolate for the ultimate indulgence.
steps: Trim 12 paper muffin cup liners to half their height.

Place 1/2 of the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe container and microwave for 2 minutes, stirring after each minute. Spoon melted chocolate into muffin cups, filling halfway. Draw the chocolate up the sides of the cups until evenly coated. Cool in the refrigerator until firm.

In a small bowl, mix peanut butter, confectioners' sugar, and salt. Divide the mixture into the chocolate cups. Melt the remaining chocolate and spoon over the peanut butter, spreading it to the edges of the cups.

title: Fudge Puddles
description: Chocolate-filled deliciousness in these fun fudge puddles!
steps: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt.

Cream together butter, peanut butter, white sugar, and brown sugar. Mix in egg and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract. Stir in the flour mixture until well combined. Shape the dough into 48 one-inch balls and place each ball in a compartment of a mini muffin tin.
For the filling, melt milk chocolate chips in a double boiler with sweetened condensed milk and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Bake for 14-16 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven and immediately create wells in the center of each cookie using a melon baller.
Cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then carefully remove to a wire rack. Fill each well with the chocolate mixture and top with a pecan half.

title: Vanilla and Chocolate Delight
description: A layer of pecans, topped with cream cheese and whipped topping, is topped with vanilla-chocolate pudding to make this chocolate delight dessert!
steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a medium mixing bowl, combine pecans, flour, and butter. Press into a 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Allow to cool.
In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and confectioners' sugar until smooth. Fold in half of the whipped topping and spread on top of cooled crust.

In another bowl, combine milk, chocolate pudding mix, and vanilla pudding mix. Beat until thick. Pour over the cream cheese layer. Top with the remaining whipped topping and sprinkle with crumbled chocolate bars.

ingredients.name: milk chocolate with crispy rice bars

title: Chocolate Chip Cheesecake
description: This is the best chocolate chip cheesecake I've ever had. People have offered to pay me to make these for them during the holidays!
steps: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Make the crust by mixing graham cracker crumbs, sugar, cocoa, and melted butter. Press into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch springform pan.
For the cheesecake filling, beat cream cheese until smooth, then add sweetened condensed milk and beat well.
Add eggs and vanilla, and beat on medium speed until smooth.
Toss 1/3 of the chocolate chips with flour to coat, then mix them into the cheesecake batter.
Pour batter into the prepared crust and sprinkle the top with the remaining chocolate chips.
Bake for 1 hour, then turn off the oven and let the cake cool in the oven (with the door closed) for another hour.
Remove from oven and cool completely. Refrigerate before removing the sides of the pan and serve cold.

title: Royal Icing
description: This royal icing recipe is a sweet white icing made with two main ingredients: pasteurized egg whites and confectioners' sugar. The icing dries quickly making it perfect for decorating gingerbread houses and holiday cut-out cookies.
steps: Gather all ingredients.
Beat egg whites in a large bowl at high speed until foamy.
Gradually add sifted confectioners' sugar and lemon or vanilla extract, continuing to beat until thickened.
Use immediately to pipe or decorate cookies.

title: Sugar Cookie Icing
description: This sugar cookie icing dries hard and shiny and the colors stay bright. Choose as many different food colorings as you desire. This recipe makes enough icing to decorate a dozen sugar cookies.
steps: Gather all ingredients.
Stir together confectioners' sugar and milk in a small bowl until smooth.
Beat in corn syrup and almond extract until icing is smooth and glossy.
If icing is too thick, add more corn syrup.
Divide icing into separate bowls and add food coloring to desired intensity.
Dip cookies or paint them with a brush.

title: Homemade Whipped Cream
description: This whipped cream recipe shows you how to make sweetened whipped cream that holds its shape. For best results make sure the whisk and bowl are ice cold.
steps: Gather all ingredients.
Whisk cream in a chilled glass or metal bowl with an electric mixer until frothy.
Add confectioners' sugar and vanilla; continue to beat until soft peaks form.
Enjoy!

title: Quick and Almost-Professional Buttercream Icing
description: After failing to find the perfect recipe for buttercream frosting, I found one that worked for me and then added my own two cents.
steps: Gather the ingredients.
Cream butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until smooth and fluffy.
Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar until fully incorporated.
Beat in vanilla extract.
Add milk and beat for an additional 3 to 4 minutes.
Add food coloring, if using, and beat for thirty seconds until smooth or until desired color is reached.
Use immediately or store buttercream in an airtight container at room temperature for up to three days.

title: Chocolate Ganache
description: Chocolate ganache is a mixture of cream and chocolate that has lots of uses with homemade baked goods. Perfect for cakes, truffles, and pastries, this deliciously rich topping can be used as a filling, frosting, or glaze.
steps: Gather all ingredients.
Place chocolate in a medium mixing bowl.
Heat cream in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring just to a boil, watching carefully to avoid overflowing.
As soon as the cream comes to a boil, pour it over the chocolate in the mixing bowl. Whisk until chocolate has melted and the mixture is smooth, then stir in rum (if using).
To use ganache as a cake glaze, cool slightly (5 to 10 minutes), then pour it onto the cake starting at the center and working outward.
For a fluffy frosting or chocolate filling, allow ganache to cool until thick (up to 1 hour in the refrigerator), then whip until light and fluffy. Apply with a spatula as a conventional frosting.

title: Whipped Cream Cream Cheese Frosting
description: This whipped cream cheese frosting is so decadent everyone will be asking if they can lick the bowl! It pipes very well.
steps: Beat whipping cream in a mixing bowl until stiff peaks form; set aside.
Combine cream cheese, sugar, salt, and vanilla in a large bowl. Beat until smooth, then fold in whipped cream.

title: One Minute Chocolate Icing
description: Make chocolate frosting without powdered sugar with this boiled fudge-like icing. Spread icing on a completely cooled cake.
steps: Combine sugar, cocoa powder, milk, butter, and vanilla in a saucepan. Bring to a rolling boil, stirring constantly; cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Beat icing with an electric mixer until mixture cools and thickens to spreading consistency, about 3 minutes.

title: Satiny Chocolate Glaze
description: Satiny chocolate drizzle for a Bundt cake. It's also great on cookies and doughnuts.
steps: Gather all ingredients.
Combine chocolate chips, butter, and corn syrup in a double boiler over hot, but not boiling water.
Gently stir until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth, then add vanilla.
To use, spread warm glaze over top of your cooled cake, letting it drizzle down the sides.

title: Real Strawberry Frosting
description: This strawberry frosting has an intense strawberry taste without using extract or gelatin. I wanted real strawberry frosting for my real strawberry cupcakes and could not find an acceptable recipe. I came up with this recipe using a strawberry puree reduction that is truly the strawberry-est. If you love strawberries, you'll love this!
steps: Place strawberries in a blender; puree until smooth.
Transfer strawberry puree to a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil, stirring often, until reduced by at least half, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely.
Beat butter with an electric mixer in a bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in 1 cup confectioners' sugar until combined.
Beat 2 tablespoons cooled strawberry puree and vanilla extract into butter mixture until just blended.
Beat in 1 cup confectioners' sugar until combined, followed by 2 tablespoons strawberry puree. Repeat this step once more.
Beat remaining 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar into mixture until just blended.

title: Quick Keto Chocolate Mousse
description: This keto chocolate mousse is perfect when a sweet craving hits. It's so quick it will be ready in no time. No need to pre-whip the heavy cream just throw everything into a bowl and mix! Use any keto-friendly granular sweetener that measures like sugar. Adjust cocoa powder and sweetener amounts to suit your tastes. This is quite rich, so you don't need a lot to feel satisfied.
steps: Beat cream cheese in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Turn mixer to low speed and slowly mix in heavy cream and vanilla extract.
Add the powdered sweetener, cocoa powder, and salt; mix until fully incorporated.
Turn the mixer to high and mix until the mixture becomes light and fluffy, about 1 to 2 minutes more.
Serve immediately, or refrigerate for later.

title: Easy Lemon Mousse
description: This lemon mousse recipe is quick and easy to make with lemon curd, whipped cream, and cream cheese. Served with fresh berries and a sprig of mint on top for a gorgeous summer dessert.
steps: Beat heavy cream in a chilled glass or metal bowl with an electric mixer until frothy. Gradually add confectioners' sugar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form, starting on low speed and increasing to high speed, for about 2 minutes; set aside.
Beat cream cheese in a bowl with an electric mixer until lump-free, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the lemon curd and vanilla extract and mix until smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes.
Fold whipped cream into the lemon mixture until just combined. Divide mousse equally among 4 dessert dishes or ramekins.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
Garnish with fresh berries and mint leaves.

title: Chocolate Mousse
description: This easy chocolate mousse recipe is made in a blender with just three ingredients. It's light, fluffy, and very tasty!
steps: Place chocolate chips in a blender; pulse until ground. Add boiling water and blend until chocolate is melted. Add egg yolks, one at a time, blending well after each addition; transfer to a mixing bowl.
Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff peaks form. Gently fold egg whites into chocolate mixture.
Pour mousse into wine glasses or other serving glasses and chill in the refrigerator until set, 2 to 3 hours.

title: Quick and Easy Pumpkin Mousse
description: This creamy pumpkin mousse with marshmallows and pumpkin pie spice is sweet and fluffy. It's easy to make for a fun treat around the holidays. Pour into chocolate shells for an elegant touch or serve with ginger cookies for dipping.
steps: Melt butter in a large skillet; stir in marshmallows, milk, and pumpkin. Stir frequently until melted and smooth. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla and pumpkin pie spice. Cool completely, about 30 minutes.
Combine 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 cup heavy cream in a large bowl. Use an electric mixer to beat until stiff peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cooled pumpkin mixture.
Pour mousse into ramekins or chocolate shells. Cover and refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours.

title: Easy Faux Chocolate Mousse
description: This is a quick recipe for a faux mascarpone 'mousse' that tricks the eyes and palate into thinking it's an authentic chocolate mousse made with eggs.
steps: Mix mascarpone cheese, whipping cream, and vanilla together in a bowl.
Melt chocolate chips in the top of a double boiler over simmering water, stirring frequently and scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching.
Fold melted chocolate into mascarpone cheese mixture. Refrigerate until set, 1 to 2 hours.

title: Chocolate Mousse for Beginners
description: This chocolate mousse for beginners is the all-time easiest method, perfect for beginners, but even experts may want to pay attention, because this technique produces the most delicious, most perfectly-textured mousse I've ever had.
steps: Break up or chop chocolate into small pieces and set aside with butter.

Add egg yolks, sugar, water, and salt to a metal mixing bowl. Cook, whisking, directly over medium-low heat until the mixture is thick, foamy, and hot to the touch (145 to 150 degrees F (63 to 65 degrees C)).

Once the yolk mixture is thick and hot, add chocolate and butter, and whisk until all chocolate is melted. Let rest for a few minutes on the counter, whisking occasionally to further cool the mixture to just above or at room temperature.
Whisk cold cream until medium stiff peaks form. If cream is whisked further, it will separate and the final texture will be grainy.

Transfer about 1/3 of chocolate mixture into whipped cream, and fold with a spatula until almost incorporated. Gently fold in remaining chocolate, trying to keep as much air in the mixture as possible.
Transfer into 4 serving dishes, wrap, and chill before serving, at least 1 hour.

title: Cocoa Powder Chocolate Mousse
description: This mousse served in shot glasses is perfect for when you're craving something sweet but just want a small portion. You can enjoy them as soon as you make them, or you can chill them in the fridge for a cooler dessert.
steps: Combine heavy whipping cream, cocoa powder, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and salt in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Pipe mousse into 6 shot glasses. Serve immediately or chill until serving.

title: Chef John's Dark Chocolate Mousse
description: This has a pinch of chile pepper as the secret ingredient. It's firm yet unbelievably light and airy. The little bit of chile pepper is in there just to bring out the flavor of the chocolate and add a tiny bit of delicious heat. Garnish each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of shaved chocolate.
steps: Bring a saucepan of water to a simmer over low heat. Place chocolate, butter, 2 tablespoons water, ground chipotle pepper, and salt in a heatproof bowl; set bowl over the simmering water. When the butter melts, whisk the chocolate mixture gently until smooth and shiny. Set aside to cool for a few minutes.

Whisk egg yolks, 2 tablespoons water, and sugar in another heatproof bowl over the same pan of simmering water until egg yolk mixture is foamy and hot to the touch, about 3 minutes. Pour hot egg mixture into warm chocolate mixture, whisk until smooth, and set over a bowl of ice to chill. Whisk constantly until mixture has cooled to room temperature or slightly cooler.

Pour 1/2 cup and 1 tablespoon cold cream into a chilled metal bowl; whisk until cream holds soft peaks. Place about half the whipped cream into the cooled chocolate mixture; gently fold the cream into the chocolate. Repeat with remaining half of whipped cream, folding gently until nearly all the streaks have disappeared.
Divide mousse into 4 6-ounce ramekins. Cover each ramekin with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours (up to overnight) before serving.

title: Brazilian Passion Fruit Mousse (Maracuja)
description: This is a Brazilian favorite (and an old family recipe) that takes no cooking at all. It's a little tart and tangy for those who don't like their desserts too sweet.
steps: Break passion fruits in half, and empty contents into a bowl. Use a little water to help rinse the juice out of the skins. Mix with hands to soften pulp. Strain through a sieve or cheesecloth.
Stir in sugar and sweetened condensed milk.
In a chilled bowl, beat cream until stiff peaks form.
Fold 1/3 of the cream into the passion fruit mixture, then quickly fold in remaining cream until no streaks remain.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.

title: Strawberry Chocolate Mousse Cake
description: Fresh strawberries and chocolate mousse make this strawberry chocolate mousse cake an appealing treat.
steps: In a bowl, mix crumbs and melted butter to blend thoroughly. Press evenly onto the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan. Arrange some strawberry halves around the pan side-by-side, pointed tips up, with cut sides against the ring of the pan; set aside.

Place chocolate chips in a blender. Pour water and corn syrup into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer for 1 minute. Immediately pour over chocolate chips and blend until smooth. Pour into a mixing bowl and cool to room temperature.

While chocolate cools, whip 1 1/2 cups cream to form stiff peaks. Use a rubber spatula or large whisk to fold 1/3 of the whipped cream into the cooled chocolate to lighten it. Gently fold in remaining whipped cream until mousse is thoroughly blended.
Transfer mousse into the prepared pan and smooth the top. The tips of the strawberries might extend above chocolate mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 4 to 24 hours.
Up to 2 hours before serving, in a medium mixing bowl, beat remaining 1/2 cup cream to form soft peaks. Add sugar. Beat to form stiff peaks.

Remove the ring of the springform pan and place cake on a serving plate. Pipe or dollop whipped cream onto the top of cake. Arrange remaining halved strawberries on whipped cream. To serve, cut into wedges with a thin knife, wiping the blade between cuts.

title: French Chocolate Mousse with Orange
description: A traditional chocolate mousse with a hint of orange flavor. This luxurious dairy-free and low-carb mousse is made simply with eggs and chocolate. Omit the orange zest for a plain chocolate mousse.
steps: Grind orange zest using a mortar and pestle until it forms a smooth paste.

Combine chocolate, coffee, and orange zest in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Stir until smooth and remove from heat. Allow to cool slightly.
Beat egg whites and salt in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff peaks form.
Add egg yolks to the slightly cooled chocolate mixture and stir until well combined. Pour over egg whites. Carefully fold together using a spatula until just combined.
Pour mixture into 10 small dessert glasses or 1 large serving dish. Refrigerate at least 6 hours to overnight.

ingredients.name: dark chocolate (65 to 70% cocao), chopped into small pieces

title: Raspberry Mousse
description: I make this raspberry mousse every year when raspberries are in season. You want to use ripe, sweet berries. Adjust sugar amount accordingly.
steps: Set a few raspberries aside for garnish. Combine remaining raspberries and confectioners' sugar in a bowl, mix, and set aside for 30 minutes. Pass raspberries through a sieve to strain out seeds. Discard seeds.
Pour orange juice into a small saucepan and sprinkle gelatin on top. Set aside for 1 minute. Heat over low temperature without boiling until gelatin is fully dissolved, about 3 minutes.
Remove from the stove, allow to cool slightly, then mix with raspberry puree.

Beat cream in a chilled glass or metal bowl using an electric mixer until frothy. Add vanilla sugar gradually, continuing to beat until soft peaks form. Fold whipped cream into raspberry puee. Stir in lemon juice and sweeten with more confectioners' sugar if desired.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Garnish with the reserved raspberries.

title: Healthy Peanut Butter Mousse
description: I whipped this up after school one day when I wanted peanut butter and a healthy snack. There are many other toppings that can be used with this such as Nutella, extra peanut butter, granola, fruit, oats, graham crackers, cookies, or cereal. The possibilities are endless!
steps: Microwave peanut butter in a microwave-safe bowl until liquid and smooth, about 20 seconds.
Stir Greek yogurt into the peanut butter with a spoon until smooth, scraping off any peanut butter stuck to the spoon. Stir in stevia and vanilla extract. Fold in chocolate chips.

title: Ultimate Irish Cream Chocolate Mousse
description: A creamy chocolate mousse flavored with Irish cream. I really didn't know I could make something so good!
steps: Melt chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Beat egg yolks in a large bowl; stir in cooled melted chocolate and Baileys. Fold in 1/2 of the whipped cream.
Beat egg whites in a separate bowl until stiff; fold into chocolate mixture.
Spoon mousse into serving glasses and garnish with remaining whipped cream and chocolate shavings before serving.

title: Tiramisu Chocolate Mousse
description: Tiramisu translates to pick-me-up. Considering that this popular Italian dessert is spiked with proven mood-elevators such as coffee, cocoa, sugar, and alcohol, the name seems to fit perfectly.
steps: Combine espresso and butter in the top of a double boiler over simmering water.

Place dark chocolate pieces in the espresso mixture; cook without stirring until chocolate starts to melt, about 3 minutes. Whisk chocolate and espresso mixture until well combined. Remove from heat and set aside.
Combine Marsala, egg yolks, and sugar in a saucepan over medium-low heat, whisking constantly until frothy and thickened, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Stir mascarpone cheese into marsala mixture.
Combine chocolate mixture with mascarpone mixture. Cool to room temperature.
Whip heavy cream in a bowl until soft peaks form, 2 to 3 minutes.
Fold half of whipped cream into cooled chocolate mixture.
Fold second half of whipped cream into chocolate mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator for at least 2 hours.

ingredients.name: dark chocolate, broken into small pieces

title: Vegan Chocolate Mousse with Aquafaba
description: This is a delicious and light chocolate mousse that is simple to make. It's made with canned chickpea liquid but you wouldn't know it. There's no chickpea taste - just fluffy, smooth, chocolate goodness! Top chocolate mousse with chocolate chips, shaved chocolate, raspberries, pistachios, or whatever you like.
steps: Melt chocolate in top of a double boiler over simmering water, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.
Beat aquafaba in a stand mixer on high speed until firm peaks form, 10 to 15 minutes. Add sugar gradually into the mixture while continuing to beat.
Fold in cooled chocolate gently.
Spoon mousse into small glass cups and chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before serving.

title: Creamiest Chocolate Mousse
description: This is one of the best chocolate mousses I've ever tried. It's so creamy (o.k. probably extremely fattening but holiday calories never count, do they?). I personally make the mousse without any alcohol added. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings for an extra special effect.
steps: Place chocolate in a metal bowl over a pan of simmering water. Stir occasionally until mostly melted, then remove from heat, and stir until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to medium stiff peaks, but do not allow it to become grainy. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, whip egg whites with salt until soft peaks form. Sprinkle in the sugar, and continue whipping to medium stiff peaks. Fold in egg yolks and kirschwasser.
Fold in the melted chocolate until completely incorporated, then fold in whipped cream until evenly blended.
Spoon into dessert cups, and chill until firm, about 1 hour.

title: Chocolate Mousse with Cocoa Powder
description: No cooking involved, and it just doesn't get much easier than this for an elegant dessert. I like to pipe the mousse into small shooter glasses for a lovely presentation. Everybody has room for a mini dessert! Chilling the bowl and beaters will result in a better whipped cream.
steps: Combine cream, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, and cocoa powder in a large chilled bowl. Beat with an electric mixer with chilled beaters until stiff peaks form; set aside.
Beat whipped cream cheese in a separate bowl until soft. Add 2 tablespoons powdered sugar gradually and beat until well combined. Mix in almond extract and beat until well incorporated.
Fold the cream cheese mixture into the chocolate whipped cream until both are completely blended.
Spoon or pipe mousse into small serving dishes. Top with grated chocolate.

title: Citrus Mousse
description: This is fast and elegant--everyone always thinks it must be a complicated recipe but it's shamefully simple. I don't know why, but I always confess after serving it that it only took a few minutes to make. Either pour it into one bowl or individual serving dishes, and garnish with fresh fruit, such as strawberries or mandarin slices. Try it with pineapple or lime juice in place of the grapefruit, if you like!
steps: In a large bowl, beat together whipped topping and condensed milk. Gradually beat in lemon and grapefruit juices, until evenly blended.
Pour the mousse into one bowl or divide it into individual serving dishes. Garnish with fruit, if desired.

title: Lemon Mousse with Berries
description: A light and lovely mousse flavored with lemon is topped with fresh berries and an optional mint garnish. Serve it in tall stemmed glasses for an elegant finish.
steps: Beat cream in medium bowl until stiff peaks form.
Stir together curd, cream cheese and almond extract in a small bowl until smooth.
Stir curd mixture into whipped cream until blended.
Divide mousse into tall stemmed glasses. Divide berries among glasses and garnish with mint, if desired.
Refrigerate until serving.

ingredients.name: Dickinson's Lemon Curd (or any flavor Dickinson's Creme Curd)

title: Easter Lemon Drop Mousse
description: This refreshingly tangy dessert pie is prepared in a 9-inch springform pan. The delicate crust is sweetened with lemon drops, and the light lemony filling is topped with whipping cream sprinkled with lemon drop sugar.
steps: To prepare the crust, combine the crushed vanilla wafers with the melted butter and 1/4 cup of the finely crushed candy (save the remainder for use as a decoration). Mix well, then press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan. Refrigerate while proceeding with the recipe.

Whisk together egg yolks, lemon juice, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons of sugar until smooth, then set aside. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until foamy. Sprinkle in the cream of tartar and continue whipping until soft peaks form. Gradually add 3/4 cups of sugar while continuing to whip to stiff peaks.
Fold the egg yolk mixture into the egg whites, then gently fold in the whipped cream until no streaks remain. Spoon this mixture into the chilled crust, and place into the freezer.

Whip the remaining 1/2 cup of whipping cream until it starts to thicken, then gradually add 3 tablespoons of light corn syrup, and continue beating until stiff. Using a pastry bag, pipe the whipped cream onto the mousse in a decorative pattern. Sprinkle the top with the reserved crushed lemon drop candy. Freeze for at least 8 hours before serving.

ingredients.name: lemon drop candies, finely crushed, divided

title: OREO Mint Chocolate Mousse
description: Instant pudding mix makes short work of this minty chocolate mousse. A garnish of fresh berries and minty cookie halves takes the dish to new heights.
steps: Beat pudding mix and milk in medium bowl with whisk 2 minutes.
Chop 10 cookies coarsely; stir into pudding with whipped topping until blended. Spoon into 8 dessert dishes.
Refrigerate 1 hour. Cut remaining cookies in half. Top desserts with cookie halves and fruit. Garnish with mint, if desired.

title: Mombasa Pumpkin Dessert
description: This dessert's coconut and creamy taste is irresistible! For the weight watchers this could be too much! You can add more sugar to this dish, according to your taste.
steps: Steam the pumpkin pieces for 5 to 10 minutes. Scoop flesh from skins.
In a medium saucepan, combine the pumpkin flesh and sugar. Heat over medium-low temperature until sugar dissolves into the pumpkin.
Add coconut milk and cardamom. Stir often and cook until the mixture has thickened to a thick pudding-like consistency.

ingredients.name: medium sugar pumpkin, seeded and cubed

title: Irish Cream Chocolate Mousse
description: A wonderful light (if slightly alcoholic) mousse that will be sure to end your dinner on the perfect note!
steps: In a mixing bowl, beat the egg yolks and sugar with an electric mixer set on medium speed until pale, creamy, and starting to thicken, about 5 minutes.

With clean beaters, whip the cream in a non-plastic bowl on medium speed until fluffy and the cream forms stiff peaks. Fold 1/3 of the yolk mixture into the whipped cream. Add the remaining yolk mixture and Irish cream liqueur, folding just until incorporated.
In a microwave-safe bowl, heat the chocolate very gently on low power just until melted; stir to dissolve any lumps.

Gently fold the chocolate into the Irish cream mixture, keeping as much fluffy volume as possible. Beat the egg whites to stiff peaks in a non-plastic bowl and fold into the chocolate mixture until evenly incorporated.
Spoon the mousse into individual dessert cups or glasses, and chill for 4 to 6 hours.

title: Tropical Mango Mousse
description: There's nothing quite so refreshing as mangos! Preparation time: 5 minutes. This recipe is from The WEBB Cooks, articles and recipes by Robyn Webb, courtesy of the American Diabetes Association.
steps: In a blender, combine mangoes, banana, yogurt, honey, ice cubes, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Refrigerate for 3 hours.
Pour into individual dishes and serve.

title: Coconut Coffee Mousse
description: This is delicious and very easy to make. Before serving, sprinkle on some confectioners' sugar and cocoa for decoration.
steps: Fold coffee liqueur and coconut into whipped topping until well combined.
Pour into 8x8 inch baking dish and freeze 4 hours, until firm.

title: Everyone Loves It Chocolate Mousse
description: Since this recipe was created, it has been requested at family holidays. I make it in big batches so that people can take some home. It is light and creamy in texture yet rich in flavor!
steps: Melt semisweet chocolate chips and milk chocolate chips in a heavy saucepan over very low heat while stirring. Stir coffee into the melted chocolate, remove from heat, and cool to room temperature.
Beat egg yolks, one at a time, into the chocolate mixture.
Beat heavy cream with an electric hand mixer in a large mixing bowl until thickened. Gradually beat sugar into the cream until the mixture is stiff.
Beat egg whites with the salt in a separate glass or metal bowl until stiff peaks form; fold into the cream mixture.

Take about 1/3 of the resulting mixture and stir into the chocolate mixture. Scrape remaining cream-and-egg mixture over lightened chocolate base and fold together gently; pour into a serving bowl or individual dessert cups.
Chill in refrigerator until set, about 2 hours.

title: Pumpkin Mousse
description: A light, airy alternative to the traditional pumpkin pie. Water can be substituted for milk if you would like a non-dairy mousse.
steps: Pour the 1/2 cup of water or milk into a small bowl and sprinkle the gelatin over it to soften.
Separate the eggs, placing the whites in an electric mixer bowl and the yolks in a heat-proof bowl that holds at least 2 cups.

Combine the milk, honey, and spices in a heavy bottomed saucepan and heat until the honey dissolves and the mixture is steaming hot. Add the softened gelatin with its liquid and stir until it is completely dissolved.

Pour most of the hot milk mixture into the egg yolks, whisking constantly, then pour this mixture back into the pot and continue heating until it thickens and almost boils. Stir in the pumpkin and keep stirring until there are no big bubbles when you stop stirring for a few seconds. Remove from the heat and whisk in the vanilla.

Beat the egg whites until frothy, then start adding the sugar gradually, beating until stiff peaks have formed. Fold a big spatula of the whites into the pumpkin custard, then fold in the remaining egg whites.

Turn the mousse into a 6-cup metal mold that has been rinsed with cold water. Chill mousse overnight. To unmold, dip the mold in hot water for about 30 seconds then invert onto a serving platter. Alternatively, spoon the mousse into individual ramekins or wine glasses that have a tablespoon or two of chopped crystallized ginger and/or gingersnap crumbs in the bottom. Serve with whipped cream.

title: Easy Chocolate Mousse
description: This chocolate mousse made with instant pudding and cool whip is easy to whisk up for a simple but delicious chocolate dessert.
steps: Whisk together milk and pudding mix in a large bowl for 2 minutes.
Fold in whipped topping until blended.
Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

title: 5 Minute Baileys Chocolate Mousse
description: In a hurry for a quick and delicious dessert? Got unexpected company drop by? This dessert is ready in less than 5 minutes. Ready to eat as soon as it is made or chill in the fridge for later.
steps: Combine heavy whipping cream, Baileys, cocoa powder, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and salt in a large bowl.
Beat with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Serve immediately or chill until serving.

title: Easy Chocolate Mousse without Eggs
description: My husband and I honeymooned in Paris two years ago. We were on our way to see the Eiffel Tower when it began to rain. Quickly, we hurried into the first cafe we came across. We ordered chocolate mousse for dessert. To say that it was divine would be an understatement. I knew I wanted to recreate that dessert for my husband when we got home. Serve in wine glasses for a nice touch.
steps: Place chocolate chips in a large bowl.

Heat 1/2 cup cream in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until it begins to rise and foam, watching carefully so it doesn't spill over, 3 to 5 minutes. Pour over chocolate chips and cover for 1 minute.
Remove cover and slowly stir with a spatula until smooth. Stir in hot coffee and vanilla extract until all chocolate has melted.
Whip remaining 1 cup cream in a chilled glass or metal bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Gently fold cream into chocolate mixture until combined.
Spoon into glasses and refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours.

ingredients.name: semisweet chocolate chips
ingredients.quantity: 1/2 (12 ounce) bag, or more to taste

title: Mama's Banana Pudding
description: Dolly Parton and her sister Rachel Parton George grew up with their mama, grandmas, and aunts making this classic dessert from scratch. This version allows you to make it from scratch, just like their family always did.
steps: Stir together 1 cup sugar, the flour, and salt in a large bowl. Whisk in milk, egg yolks, and whole eggs until well combined and smooth.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Pour milk mixture into saucepan with butter; reduce heat to medium-low and whisk constantly until the mixture has thickened, coats the back of a spoon nicely, and begins to bubble, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla. Cover and let custard cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. (It will continue to thicken as it cools.)

Peel and slice bananas. Line the bottom and sides of 2 (9x13-inch) broiler-safe casserole dishes with vanilla wafers. Layer banana slices over wafers. Pour cooled custard over bananas and wafers, smoothing top with a knife or spatula.

For meringue, in a large clean bowl, using an electric mixer or a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat egg whites, cream of tartar, and the remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla at high speed until stiff peaks form, about 5 minutes. Spoon meringue over top of custard, covering it completely.
Set oven rack about 4 inches from broiler; turn broiler to high. Quickly broil meringues until browned, about 1 to 2 minutes. (This happens very quickly, so keep a close eye on it.)
Remove dishes from oven, allow meringue to cool slightly, about 15 minutes, and serve. (Chill, covered, up to 4 days.)

title: Bread Pudding
description: This traditional bread pudding is decadent, delicious, and easy to make with basic ingredients. Perfect for breakfast or dessert, it pairs wonderfully with milk or a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place bread pieces into an 8-inch square baking pan. Drizzle melted butter over bread and sprinkle raisins over top.
Whisk milk, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, and vanilla together in a medium mixing bowl until well combined.
Pour mixture over bread, and lightly push down with a fork until all bread is covered and soaking up the liquid.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and the top springs back when lightly pressed, about 45 minutes.

ingredients.name: day-old bread, torn into small pieces

title: The Best Banana Pudding
description: This no-cook banana pudding recipe is easy to make and delicious layered with vanilla wafers and slices of banana. It's the best banana pudding you will ever find (or so I've been told by many)!
steps: Place milk and pudding mix in a large bowl; beat with a whisk for 2 minutes. Blend in condensed milk until smooth.
Stir in vanilla, then fold in whipped topping.
Layer wafers, banana slices, and pudding mixture in a glass serving bowl.
For best results, chill pudding in the refrigerator for at least an hour before serving. Top with extra crushed wafers before serving.

title: Creamy Rice Pudding
description: This sweet rice pudding is thick, creamy, and utterly decadent. Made with basic ingredients you likely already have on hand, this rice pudding recipe is the perfect comforting treat.
steps: Pour water into a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat; stir in rice. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Combine cooked rice, 1 1/2 cups milk, sugar, and salt in a clean saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until thick and creamy, about 15 minutes.
Stir in remaining 1/2 cup milk, beaten egg, and raisins; cook 2 minutes more, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla until combined.
Serve warm.

title: Best Old-Fashioned Creamy Rice Pudding
description: This rice pudding with cooked rice, milk, sugar, and an egg gets added flavor from butter and vanilla in this quick stovetop dessert.
steps: Place cooked rice in a medium saucepan. Add 1 1/2 cups milk and salt; cook and stir until thick and creamy, 15 to 20 minutes.
Add remaining 1/2 cup milk, golden raisins, beaten egg, and white sugar; continue cooking, stirring continuously, until well blended, 2 to 3 minutes more.
Remove saucepan from heat; stir in butter and vanilla extract.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Homemade Banana Pudding
description: This homemade banana pudding recipe from scratch was handed down from my grandmother. My whole family loves it and we all grew up on it. Enjoy this classic dessert!
steps: Combine sugar, flour, and salt together in a medium saucepan. Add eggs and stir well. Stir in milk, and cook over low heat, stirring constantly.
When the mixture has thickened enough to coat the back of a metal spoon, remove from heat and continue to stir, cooling slightly. Stir in butter and vanilla until smooth.
Layer pudding with bananas and vanilla wafers in a serving dish.
Chill at least 1 hour in the refrigerator before serving.

title: Chocolate Cornstarch Pudding
description: My mom's best chocolate pudding recipe, made with cornstarch and cocoa. A simple and delicious dessert that can be served warm or chilled.
steps: Stir together sugar, cocoa, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan. Place over medium heat, and stir in milk.
Bring to a boil, and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a metal spoon.
Remove from heat, and stir in butter and vanilla.
Let cool briefly, and serve warm, or chill in the refrigerator until serving.

title: Dirt Pudding
description: This dirt pudding tastes so good! It's very easy to make, and there are so many different ways to present it.
steps: Whisk milk and pudding mix in a large bowl until softly set, about 2 minutes. The pudding will thicken as it stands.
Beat confectioners' sugar, cream cheese, and butter in a separate bowl until smooth and creamy.
Stir cream cheese mixture into pudding until thoroughly combined; gently fold in frozen whipped topping.
Place 1/2 of the cookie crumbs into the bottom of a 9x12-inch dish; spread evenly.
Cover cookie crumbs with pudding mixture and top with remaining crumbs, covering completely.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.

title: Baked Rice Pudding
description: This baked rice pudding recipe is lovely served warm. It has the appeal of homemade comfort food.
steps: Place rice in a 3-quart saucepan and add water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 25 to 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Mix eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt together in a large bowl until combined.
Stir in cooked rice and raisins. Transfer into a 10x6x2 inch baking dish.
Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 30 minutes; stir pudding and sprinkle with nutmeg. Continue to bake until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes more.

title: Homemade Vanilla Pudding
description: This homemade pudding with vanilla is a rich and delectable dessert. There is no substitute for the butter!
steps: Heat milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat until bubbles form at the edges.
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt together in a small bowl.
Add sugar, cornstarch, and salt mixture to hot milk, a little at a time, stirring until thick enough to coat the back of the spoon.
Remove saucepan from heat, and stir in vanilla and butter.
Spoon pudding evenly into 5 serving dishes. For best results, chill pudding in the refrigerator before serving.

title: Tembleque Puerto Rican Coconut Pudding
description: Tembleque, which means 'wiggly,' is a creamy coconut pudding, perfect for serving as a sweet, chilled dessert with a hint of cinnamon.
steps: Stir together coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan.
Spoon 3 to 4 tablespoons of the coconut milk mixture into a small bowl and stir in cornstarch until dissolved; pour back into the saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a boil while stirring constantly; cook until smooth and thick, about 5 minutes.
Pour into molds, cover each with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until cold and firm, 3 hours to 2 days.
Run a thin knife around the edges of each mold; invert onto serving plates. Garnish tops with cinnamon.

title: Chia Coconut Pudding with Coconut Milk
description: This chia seed pudding with coconut milk is a healthy and refreshing dessert alternative, rich in omega-3s and perfect with a touch of cinnamon and fresh fruit.
steps: Whisk together sweetened and unsweetened coconut milks, agave nectar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl.
Stir in chia seeds and allow the mixture to soak until thickened, at least 20 minutes, or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Stir the pudding before serving and top with diced fresh strawberries.

title: Classic Tapioca Pudding
description: A classic tapioca pudding recipe that serves as a comforting treat, perfect either warm or chilled.
steps: Mix milk, tapioca, sugar, and salt in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat to low and cook while stirring for an additional 5 minutes.
Gradually whisk 1 cup of the hot milk mixture into the beaten eggs, adding 2 tablespoons at a time to temper the eggs.

Stir the egg mixture back into the tapioca mixture until well combined and bring to a gentle simmer over medium-low heat; cook and stir for 2 more minutes until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract.
Serve hot or pour into serving dishes and refrigerate for several hours until cold.

title: Gramma's Apple Bread Pudding
description: An apple bread pudding with warm vanilla sauce, offering a cozy and nostalgic taste of home.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 7x11-inch baking dish.
Combine bread cubes, apples, and raisins in a large bowl.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, cook and stir milk, brown sugar, and butter until the butter is melted. Pour over the bread mixture and mix until evenly coated. Transfer to the prepared baking dish.
Whisk eggs, cinnamon, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. Pour over the bread mixture in the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the center is set and apples are tender, 40 to 50 minutes.
To prepare the vanilla sauce, mix milk, butter, white sugar, and brown sugar in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and stir in vanilla extract.
Serve the pudding with the warm vanilla sauce.

title: Chocolate Avocado Pudding
description: A rich, vegan chocolate pudding made with avocados for a creamy and healthy twist.
steps: Blend avocados, cocoa powder, brown sugar, coconut milk, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon in a blender until smooth.
Transfer the pudding to a container with a lid and refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes.

ingredients.name: large avocados, peeled, pitted, and cubed

title: Southern-Style Baked Banana Pudding
description: A classic Southern baked banana pudding, perfect for those who love the flavors of banana cream pie without the hassle of a crust.
steps: Separate eggs, placing the whites in a stand mixer bowl and yolks into a saucepan.
Add sugar, salt, and flour to the yolks. Add 1/4 of the milk and whisk until blended, then add remaining milk and whisk until smooth.
Cook over medium heat while whisking until custard thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in banana liqueur, vanilla, and cold butter until butter dissolves. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Toss banana slices with lemon juice.

Layer 1/4 of the custard in a baking dish. Add a layer of vanilla wafers, 1/2 of the bananas, and 1/2 of the remaining custard. Repeat with another layer of wafers, remaining bananas, and custard. Smooth top.
Prepare meringue: Add cream of tartar to egg whites and beat until foamy. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff peaks form.
Spread meringue over pudding and bake for 7-10 minutes until browned. Serve warm or chilled.

title: Slow Cooker Rice Pudding
description: Super easy crockpot rice pudding made in a slow cooker for a creamy, comforting treat.
steps: Stir 4 cups milk, sugar, and rice together in a slow cooker until sugar dissolves.
Add margarine, cover, and cook on High for 2 1/2 hours.
Whisk egg, 2 tablespoons milk, vanilla, almond extract, and salt together in a bowl.
Pour a small amount of hot rice mixture into egg mixture, whisking quickly to avoid cooking the egg.
Pour the egg mixture back into the slow cooker and whisk until combined.
Continue to cook on High until creamy, about 15 more minutes.
Transfer pudding to a glass baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap, leaving two corners uncovered to vent, and refrigerate until chilled completely, at least 1 hour.

title: Budin (Puerto Rican Bread Pudding)
description: Budin is a traditional Puerto Rican bread pudding, a comforting dessert made with day-old bread and a rich caramelized top.
steps: Bring 1 cup water to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat. Add cinnamon sticks, cloves, and anise seed. Cover and set aside to steep for 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, combine 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir occasionally to dissolve sugar completely, but stop stirring once the mixture comes to a boil. Stay near the stove to monitor the color, swirling the pan gently to redistribute the sugar as it darkens. Cook until sugar turns light golden brown, then pour into a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Set aside to allow caramel to harden.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Remove crust from day-old bread, tear bread into cubes, and place into a large mixing bowl. Strain spice tea through a fine mesh sieve to remove spices. Add to bread along with evaporated milk. Stir to evenly moisten and set aside for 10 minutes.

While the bread mixture sits, whisk eggs in a large mixing bowl along with remaining 1 1/2 cups sugar, vanilla, salt, and melted butter. Stir in moistened bread mixture until evenly mixed. Pour into the loaf pan over the caramel.

Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place the loaf pan on the towel, inside the roasting pan, and place the roasting pan on the oven rack. Fill the roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the loaf pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Cool in the pan for about an hour, then refrigerate until cold, 2 hours more.
When ready, invert the budin onto a serving plate. The caramel will have turned to syrup and will cover the budin like a sauce.

title: Dairy-Free Chocolate Pudding
description: This dairy-free chocolate pudding is a simple, smooth, and creamy vegan dessert perfect for anyone avoiding dairy. It's quick and easy to prepare.
steps: Mix cornstarch and water together in a small bowl until a paste forms.

Combine soy milk, sugar, cocoa, and vanilla in a large saucepan; stir in cornstarch paste until well combined. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until boiling. Continue to cook and stir until mixture thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let cool for 5 minutes; pudding will continue to thicken as it cools. Cover and refrigerate until completely cool, 1 to 2 hours.

title: Custard Bread Pudding
description: A creamy and rich custard bread pudding with more custard than bread, this recipe has been a family favorite for years. It's perfect for those who prefer a custard-heavy dessert.
steps: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Arrange bread slices in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with raisins and cinnamon.
Blend half-and-half, sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, and salt in a blender until smooth.
Pour the egg mixture over the bread in the baking dish.
Place the baking dish in a large roasting pan, and fill the pan with boiling water halfway up the sides of the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 1 1/2 hours. Serve warm or cold.

title: Uncooked Banana Pudding
description: This quick and easy uncooked banana pudding combines sour cream, vanilla pudding mix, bananas, milk, and whipped topping for a delicious dessert ready in just 10 minutes.
steps: Stir milk, sour cream, whipped topping, and pudding mix together in a bowl until well combined.
Place a layer of vanilla wafer cookies in the bottom of a trifle bowl.
Cover with a layer of pudding mixture, then a layer of sliced bananas.
Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used.

title: Brown Sugar and Cinnamon Rice Pudding
description: This easy-to-make rice pudding with brown sugar and cinnamon is perfect for breakfast or dessert. It's also gluten-free and ready in 25 minutes.
steps: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add rice, butter, and salt; cook and stir until butter melts, then cover the saucepan and remove from the heat. Set aside until water is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
Stir milk, brown sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla into rice; bring to a simmer over medium heat while stirring. Cook until rice has the consistency of loose oatmeal, about 5 minutes.
Ladle pudding into bowls and dust with cinnamon.

title: Rice Cooker Rice Pudding
description: This easy rice pudding recipe made in a rice cooker is creamy and delicious. Serve with extra cinnamon sprinkled on top for added flavor.
steps: Stir 5 1/2 cups milk, rice, sugar, and cinnamon together in a rice cooker. Cover and cook for one cycle until tender and creamy, about 20 minutes.
Stir in remaining 2 1/2 cups milk.
Transfer to a bowl and let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours before serving.

title: Almond Milk Instant Pudding
description: This easy instant pudding recipe made with almond milk has the perfect taste and consistency. It takes slightly more mixing than normal to achieve the ideal texture.
steps: Pour 1 cup almond milk into a small saucepan. Add cornstarch and heat over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until bubbly, about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and keep stirring for 30 seconds.
Pour remaining almond milk into a bowl and add pudding mix. Mix with an electric mixer on low speed until very thick, about 1 minute.
Add cornstarch mixture to pudding mixture and mix at low speed for 1 minute more.
Transfer pudding to 4 individual serving bowls. Cover and refrigerate if desired.

title: Healthier Creamy Rice Pudding
description: A healthy and delicious version of rice pudding made with brown rice for extra nutrition and fiber. This comforting dessert is creamy, lightly sweetened, and perfect for a healthier treat.
steps: Combine water and rice in a saucepan over high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 45 minutes.
In a clean saucepan, combine cooked rice, 1 1/2 cups milk, sugar, and salt. Cook over medium heat until thick and creamy, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Stir in remaining 1/2 cup milk, beaten egg, and raisins. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla extract. Serve warm.

title: Bread Pudding in the Slow Cooker
description: This slow cooker bread pudding recipe is perfect for breakfast, brunch, or dessert. It's easy to prepare and comes out deliciously rich and comforting.
steps: Place bread and raisins into a slow cooker.
Whisk milk, eggs, melted butter, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg together in a bowl; pour over bread and raisins. Toss to evenly coat.
Cover and cook on Low until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean, about 3 hours.

title: Kheer (Rice Pudding)
description: A flavorful and easy-to-make Indian rice pudding made with coconut milk, basmati rice, raisins, and nuts. It's the best rice pudding you've ever had!
steps: Bring coconut milk, milk, and sugar to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add rice, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until the mixture thickens and rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in raisins, cardamom, and rose water; cook for a few more minutes.
Ladle into serving bowls and garnish with almonds and pistachios.

title: Bread Pudding with Whiskey Sauce
description: This bread pudding with whiskey sauce is a deliciously rich dessert, perfect for Sunday brunch or any occasion. The whiskey sauce adds a special touch to this comforting treat.
steps: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Mix milk, eggs, 3 tablespoons melted butter, and vanilla in a large bowl until well combined. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar and mix thoroughly until sugar dissolves.
Place bread cubes into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Pour milk-egg mixture over the bread, fully saturating it. Sprinkle with pecans.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 1 hour.
In the final minutes of baking, combine 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup butter, cream, and whiskey in a saucepan over low heat. Stir constantly until the sauce is gently boiling.
Remove bread pudding from the oven and pour the whiskey sauce over the top. Serve warm.

title: Hasty Chocolate Pudding
description: This easy microwave chocolate pudding comes together in minutes, perfect for a quick chocolate fix. You can even stir in chopped bananas for an extra boost of nutrition.
steps: Whisk together sugar, cocoa, and cornstarch in a microwave-safe bowl.
Whisk in milk a little at a time, until no dry lumps remain.
Cook in the microwave on high for 3 minutes. Stir well. Continue cooking and stirring at 1-minute intervals until shiny and thick, 2 to 4 minutes.
Mix in vanilla.
Press a piece of plastic wrap directly onto the surface of the pudding to prevent skin from forming.
Place in the refrigerator to chill. Serve cold.
